TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ServiceBusSender extends System.Object implements class System.IAsyncDisposable

Docs.summary: A client responsible for sending to a specific Service Bus entity (Queue or Topic). It can be used for both session and non-session entities. It is constructed by calling .
Docs.remarks: The is safe to cache and use for the lifetime of an application or until the that it was created by is disposed. Caching the sender is recommended when the application is publishing messages regularly or semi-regularly. The sender is responsible for ensuring efficient network, CPU, and memory use. Calling on the associated as the application is shutting down will ensure that network resources and other unmanaged objects used by the sender are properly cleaned up.

Docs.param: An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.
Docs.summary:
Creates a size-constraint batch to which may be added using a . If a message would exceed the maximum allowable size of the batch, the batch will not allow adding the message and signal that scenario using it return value.
Because messages that would violate the size constraint cannot be added, publishing a batch will not trigger an exception when attempting to send the messages to the Queue/Topic.
Docs.returns: An with the default batch options.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask<Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessageBatch> CreateMessageBatchAsync (Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.CreateMessageBatchOptions options, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken = default);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask`1<class Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessageBatch> CreateMessageBatchAsync(class Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.CreateMessageBatchOptions options, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed
Public Overridable Function CreateMessageBatchAsync (options As CreateMessageBatchOptions, Optional cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As ValueTask(Of ServiceBusMessageBatch)

abstract member CreateMessageBatchAsync : Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.CreateMessageBatchOptions * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask<Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessageBatch> override this.CreateMessageBatchAsync : Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.CreateMessageBatchOptions * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask<Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusMessageBatch>

Docs.param: The set of options to consider when creating this batch.
An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.
Docs.summary:
Creates a size-constraint batch to which may be added using a try-based pattern. If a message would exceed the maximum allowable size of the batch, the batch will not allow adding the message and signal that scenario using its return value.
Because messages that would violate the size constraint cannot be added, publishing a batch will not trigger an exception when attempting to send the messages to the Queue/Topic.

Docs.param: The to schedule.
The UTC time at which the message should be available for processing
An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.
Docs.summary: Schedules a message to appear on Service Bus at a later time.
Docs.returns: The sequence number of the message that was scheduled.
Docs.remarks: Although the message will not be available to be received until the scheduledEnqueueTime, it can still be peeked before that time. Messages can also be scheduled by setting and using , , or .
Docs.exception: Occurs when the has a member in its collection that is an unsupported type for serialization. See the remarks for details.

Docs.param: The set of messages to send.
An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.
Docs.summary: Sends a set of messages to the associated Service Bus entity using a batched approach. If the size of the messages exceed the maximum size of a single batch, an exception will be triggered and the send will fail. In order to ensure that the messages being sent will fit in a batch, use instead.
Docs.returns: A task to be resolved on when the operation has completed.
Docs.exception: The set of messages exceeds the maximum size allowed in a single batch, as determined by the Service Bus service. The will be set to in this case. For more information on service limits, see .
Occurs when one of the has a member in its collection that is an unsupported type for serialization. See the remarks for details.
